column2: We are looking for a hard-working professional who will be able to undertake a variety of office support tasks, work diligently and deliver under pressure   This person will be comfortable working with a high degree of attention to detail and discretion as well as incorporating new and effective ways to achieve better results for the workplace   We need someone with excellent communication skills, good typing/writing skills, bold yet calm under pressure and a great relationship builder who can bring a lot of positive energy to the floor   You are expected to be everywhere and manage a great deal of little things     Responsibilities        Organize shop floors, maintain premises (with the help of vendors and/or other workers).        Organize meetings, distribute minutes and maintain timetables and daily plans.     Maintain attendance and leaves for all employees and submit reports to management on a monthly basis. Will also liaise between employees and management for leave approval, out of schedule work hours etc     Organize small events and help the team with organizing bigger events as and when necessary.     Create, update and maintain inventory of goods and supplies. Create POs and work with various vendors and suppliers to negotiate and place orders.     Resolve office-related malfunctions and facility issues by working with vendors and other workers.     Maintain various documents - POs, bills, packing slips and dispatch orders and generate reports on a monthly basis.     Level 1 customer support - answer primary business phone, SMSs and WhatsApp queries from various customers, prioritize and channel customer queries and escalations. Take order over the phone.    Maintain Shopify store: Work with the management and the product owners to create and maintain product content and website pages.   Manage Shopify apps to manage various features of the store and admin module of Shopify.   Generate weekly and monthly report and analysis for the management      Qualities and Qualifications:     Hardworking, punctual and extremely   conscientious but with an uplifting personality and a lot of positive energy. Ability to keep a good vibe even in tough times.    Must be fluent in speaking and understanding any two of these languages: Hindi, Telugu or Bengali.    Must have experience working with Shopify or similar applications.    Basic understanding of managing a web store.   Working experience with Canva or similar applications.   Good understanding of excel/workbooks and typical office suite and how to use them in real life scenarios to solve problems.   Willingness to learn and drive efficiency wherever possible without incurring cost/investment - a creative thinker inside the box.    2 years of experience in a similar role.   We will consider fresh graduates if they can convince us that they have what it takes to do the job and have the qualities and qualifications as mentioned above.   Graduate in any discipline, however, we will pay more attention to what you have done outside of your curriculum than what you studied to get the grades
column13: Order management, Bengali, Administration, Report generation, Packaging, Manager Technology, Customer support, Research, Management, Office Administrator

column2: As the Senior Product Manager, you will be responsible for the ongoing development and maintenance of Fictiv s Manufacturing Quoting & Fulfillment platform that interfaces with customers, operations teams, and a growing global manufacturing partner network. You will own the strategy, roadmap, and implementation of solutions related to your areas of responsibility without compromising customer satisfaction, growth, reliable delivery, and operational efficiency. The solutions you will contribute to are the primary strategic vehicle for providing differentiated value to our customers and manufacturing partners to deliver best-in-class manufacturing service offerings.In this role, you will serve as the domain expert in understanding the needs of our customers and manufacturing partners, bridging the potential of technology, operational process needs, and business goals into innovative solutions that will set new standards for speed and quality of quoting and fulfilment.      What You ll Be Doing     Business acumen and domain awareness       You will research and evaluate the needs of our customers to understand their priorities and their new product development challenges, as well as hear and assess their feedback on their Fictiv experience.     You will assess the needs of internal users, understand the relevant operational workflows, and be able to identify opportunities to meaningfully increase operational efficiency.     You will assess the needs of our growing network of manufacturing partners, understand their business goals, and capabilities, and be able to identify opportunities to deliver differentiated value.     Develop a strategic vision for how to deliver on critical business goals and support Fictiv s growth trajectory. Build and execute a product roadmap that will evolve the solution to realize this vision.       Roadmap work analysis, breakdown, and scoping          Analyze, comprehend, and take ownership of the product roadmap related to your area of responsibility and translate high-level goals into detailed objectives and projects.     Develop a robust framework for tracking input and output metrics, providing a quantitative assessment of the success and impact of each project.     Build the business case for expanding capabilities and secure alignment on investments among the management team and stakeholders.     Scope and define the requirements for each roadmap item to ensure clarity and alignment with overall product objectives.     Navigate and manage trade-offs between speed of delivery and maintaining project scope for overall project success.     Estimate project scope and timeline in collaboration with the engineering development team.     Proactively identify potential risks associated with scope decisions and work collaboratively with teams to develop mitigation strategies that align with project timelines and business objectives.     Establish a point of view of the problems to solve and bring those insights to the team.       Cross-functional collaboration       Build and maintain strong working relationships with key stakeholders to understand their unique challenges and create a foundation for successful collaboration.     Engage with teams to ensure a comprehensive understanding of the product roadmap, actively seeking input and insights.     Foster a collaborative environment where input from various departments is encouraged, promoting a holistic approach to scoping and defining product requirements.     Work with cross-functional stakeholders across software engineering, user experience design, operations, and sales and marketing to develop hypotheses and high-impact solutions.     Lead cross-functional meetings to facilitate communication between teams, establish mutual understanding, build consensus on scope, align priorities, and break down work to deliver on goals.     Actively seek feedback from stakeholders on project deliverables and adjust plans accordingly, fostering a responsive and collaborative approach to project management.       Execution and risk management       Implement Agile methodologies to organize and manage upcoming sprints, ensuring a streamlined and efficient development process.     Analyze metrics to measure success, adapting the product as needed to optimize for business outcomes and strategic priorities.     Continuously refine and increase the fidelity of project timelines as the project progresses, leveraging collaboration with the development team to address issues that may impact the estimated timelines.     Keep stakeholders apprised of project progress, providing regular updates on milestones achieved and potential deviations from the plan.     Partner with development teams in India and the US to achieve successful outcomes through communication of business needs, requirements, and priorities while removing friction where needed.     Drive product launches by ensuring that all parts of the organization are prepared at launch.      Create trust and transparency by communicating team progress and results to stakeholders; help the organization celebrate successes and learn from failures.     Travel 20% annually for team meetings, research, and training.     Maintain a daily time overlap with the US hours to communicate with teams, stakeholders, and users.     Desired Traits       Past Experience        Proven track record of product lifecycle management with 5 years of experience as a product manager, preferably focused on B2B software applications.     Experience navigating systems with interdependencies and integrations, showcasing an ability to strategically manage complex technical landscapes.     Experience developing and gaining agreement on business plans or roadmaps.     History of orchestrating complex end-to-end processes involving multiple roles, emphasizing a comprehensive understanding of cross-functional collaboration and workflow optimization.     Experience in business analysis, showcasing proficiency in optimizing internal workflows and business metrics to enhance overall efficiency and performance.     Experience in Agile methodologies and the ability to apply them to optimize development processes.     Practical experience in leveraging customer insights and metrics to drive and strategic product decisions and nurture growth.     Understanding of the business model as a manufacturing service provider.          Desired        Experience in manufacturing, supply chains, or industries where intricate processes and logistical considerations are important to product development and delivery.     Some operating or technical knowledge in one or more manufacturing processes (3D Printing, CNC, Injection Molding, Sheet Metal, etc).
column13: Business analysis, Sheet metal, Project management, Machine learning, Agile, Manager Technology, Workflow, Risk management, Operations, Business case

column2: 1. Procurement Coordination and Execution:   Coordinate procurement activities, including sourcing, purchasing, and inventory management, in accordance with established guidelines and timelines.   Liaise with domestic and international vendors to ensure timely delivery of products and services, while maintaining optimal inventory levels.   Execute procurement transactions in ERP systems, ensuring accuracy and compliance with company policies and procedures.   Collaborate with cross-functional teams to support procurement requirements for various projects and initiatives.   2. Vendor Management:   Assist in the evaluation and selection of vendors based on quality, price, and delivery capabilities.   Maintain relationships with vendors, addressing any issues or concerns that may arise during the procurement process.   Monitor vendor performance and compliance with contractual agreements, taking corrective action as necessary.   3. Pre-Sales and Post-Sales Support:   Provide procurement support to sales teams during the pre-sales process, including pricing, availability, and invoicing, sourcing of products.   Coordinate with post-sales teams to ensure timely resolution of procurement related issues, warranty claims, and spare parts management.   4. Supply Chain Coordination:   Work closely with logistics and warehouse teams to coordinate inbound and outbound shipments, ensuring efficient flow of goods through the supply chain.   Monitor inventory levels and coordinate replenishment activities to meet customer demand while minimizing excess inventory and carrying costs.   5. Process Management and Improvement:   Implement and adhere to standardized procurement processes and procedures to ensure consistency and efficiency.   Identify opportunities for process improvement and optimization, collaborating with stakeholders to implement best practices and drive continuous improvement.     Qualifications and Skills:    Bachelor s degree in Business Administration, Supply Chain Management, or a related field.   5+ years of experience in procurement coordination and execution, preferably in the printing or manufacturing industry.   Proficiency in ERP systems, such as SAP, Oracle, or Microsoft Dynamics, and Microsoft Office Suite.   Strong organizational and time management skills, with the ability to prioritize tasks and meet deadlines.   Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams.   Detail-oriented with strong analytical skills and problem-solving abilities
column11: Any Graduate, B.B.A/ B.M.S in Management, Any Postgraduate

column2: We are looking for a Machine Learning (ML) Engineer to join our Economist Group engineering team. Your primary focus will be to design, develop, ship, maintain and oversee the overall architecture of our Economist.com data platforms - with a focus on systems related to our customer facing products. The initial focus will be around implementing appropriate data infrastructure required to enable predictive analytics and ML algorithms, and in conjunction with the Head of AI and Data Engineering support the organisation to implement their vision. The team will also support the Economist Intelligence Unit (EIU) in similar work related to forecasting technology. Youll also work with individuals from our corporate data team (responsible for reporting, analytics and insights), as well as work collaboratively with data scientists and analysts in other teams across the organisation. Role & responsibilities  Architecting, building and maintaining ML processing pipelines / workflows in Python via technologies such as Spark, serverless functions, Airflow, MLflow, or other.Implement MLOps and related DevOps focused on creating ML pipelines for deploying models for large scale inference and optimisations.Build batch and real time ML pipelines for recommendation, customer lifetime value and propensity models.Support, optimise and transition our current processes to ensure well architected implementations and best practices.Work in an agile environment within a collaborative agile product team using KanbanCollaborate across departments and work closely with data science teams and with business (economists/data) analysts in refining their data requirements for various initiatives and data consumption requirements.Educate and train colleagues such as data scientists, analysts, and stakeholders in ML pipelining and data processing techniques, which make it easier for them to integrate and consume the data they need for their own use cases.Participate in ensuring compliance and governance during ML model use, to ensure that the users and consumers use the resources provisioned to them responsibly through data governance and compliance initiatives.Become an data and ML evangelist, and promote the available ML capabilities and expertise to business unit leaders, and educate them in leveraging these.Preferred candidate profile  7+ years of professional experience with ML operations used in large scale digital applications.Extensive experience with programming in Python, Jupyter notebooks, Spark, and DockerProfessional experience of designing, building and managing bespoke MLOps in cloud environments, using tools such as SageMaker Processing, SageMaker Pipelines, Apache Airflow, and MLflow.Strong, fundamental technical expertise in cloud-native technologies, such as serverless functions, API gateway, container registry, Cloud Formation / CDK.Experience in leading / mentoring ML engineering teams.Experience in working in teams with data scientists and data engineers, for building automated pipelines for model building, deployment and monitoring.An advanced degree in computer science, information science, data science, or a related quantitative field or equivalent work experience.Strong verbal and written communication skills and ability to work well with a wide range of stakeholders.Strong ownership, scrappy and biassed for action.Perks and benefits
column13: cloud-native, Docker, Cloud, Machine Learning, Python, Apache Airflow, MLflow., Jupyter notebooks, SageMaker Processing, Spark, SageMaker Pipelines

column1: Accountant cum Admin person For Congo Kinshasa
column2: MAXIMUM AGE OF APPLICANT SHOULD NOT EXCEED 35 YEARS. We are an offset printing company based in DR Congo, Africa - We are looking for a young mature, responsible, motivated, enthusiastic, honest, energetic accountant. Chartered accounting knowledge is highly preferred.Your responsibility will be to work alongside the General Manager and assist in the administration side of things. You must have good computer knowledge, in particular excel, work, internet and email.Please read all conditions below before applying for the job.We are looking for an active young individual who is willing to move to DR Congo in Africa for a minimum 2 year contract, but with a long term view. You must be very proactive, enthusiastic, motivated, willing to learn, take initiative and will be willing to move up the ladder in the company.This position is for an Immediate start. You will be required to have a minimum of 5 years experience as an accountant. Congo is a french speaking country, hence english language knowledge is a must, both written and spoken. Roles and Responsibilities1. Managing the daily accounting and admin operations of the company such as petty cash management, negotiating with supplier, employees, customers etc.2. Looking after importation of goods. 3. Managing Staff, Government Problems, Purchasing department, Housekeeping and General Maintenance.4. Dealing with local staff, and local accountant.5. Tally and accounting knowledge is a must. 6. Business acumen is required. 7. Prepare Cash book, Budgets, Profit and loss, balance sheet statements, cash flow statements8. Dealing with government personnel. 9. Knowledge of Tally software and accounting in a must.10. Collections of debts from customers. 11. Monitoring vehicle movements and scrutinizing expenses.12. Organising deliveries of finished goods.13. Conducting monthly physical stock take.Desired Candidate Profile1. Languages: (English a must)2. Work Experience: Atleast 5 years as an accountant in reputed industry, preferably manufacturing. 3. Educational Qualifications: Graduate/Post Grad, accounting knowledge is a must. Chartered accounting knowledge is highly regarded.4. It would be preferable if the candidate has exposure outside india.Salary & Accomodation1. Salary: Open for discussion, depends on experience $1000 - $1200US.2. Send you resume to recruitment@instaprint.org with the subject line Accountant - Kinshasa3. Accommodation and other benefits. Candidate: 1.You must be between 22 and 35 years of age 2. You must be a non drinker or light drinker. 3. You must not have any health issues and must be active and physically fit.4. You are willing to take up a new challenge in life to progress and be promoted in the company.5. You will be responsible for assisting the GM in getting the work done. You will be required to multi task and manage a team under you, so we require someone who is a responsible mature person with leadership qualities and has good negotiating skills with customers.6. We expect that you have experience in all of the above prior to coming to Congo.7. Salary range is USD 1000 - 1200 depending on experience.8. An online test will be required to be passed by all applicants before proceeding to the interview stage.We require a deposit of 50,000 rupees from you on acceptance of our offer. This deposit will be refunded to you within 7 days of arriving to congo. The reason for this deposit is so that we know you are serious and you will not change your mind after we begin applying for your visa and purchase your air ticket. Normally it will cost us 100,000 rupees for your visa and airticket.PLEASE ONLY APPLY IF YOU MEET ALL CRITERIA ABOVE. IF YOU DO NOT MEET ALL CRITERIA ABOVE, PLEASE DO NOT APPLY.
column11: B.Com in Commerce, MBA/PGDM in Any Specialization, M.Com in Commerce, CA in Any Specialization

Your primary focus will be to design, develop, ship, maintain and oversee the overall architecture of our Economist.com data platforms - with a focus on systems related to our customer facing products. The initial focus will be around implementing appropriate data infrastructure required to enable predictive analytics, ML algorithms, and Generative AI applications, and in conjunction with the Head of AI and Data Engineering support the organization to implement their vision. Youll also work with individuals from our corporate data team (responsible for reporting, analytics and insights), as well as work collaboratively with data scientists and analysts in other teams across the organization.The role will suit either an existing senior or a mid-level NLP Engineer, or even an ML Engineer ready for their next challenge, but with at least some experience leading or mentoring a high performing team. services.Setting up Retrieval Augmented Generation (RAG) architectures and Reinforcement Learning from Human Feedback (RLHF) processes.Implement MLOps and related DevOps focused on LLMs deployed in column2: Location: Daryaganj, Delhi Role Overview: As a Supply Chain Executive, you will be responsible for overseeing and optimizing the flow of materials, goods, and services from suppliers to customers. Your role is pivotal in ensuring the efficiency, cost-effectiveness, and reliability of the supply chain process. Working within a dynamic environment, you will collaborate with various internal departments and external suppliers to meet organizational objectives. What would you do?  Procurement: Source and procure materials, goods, and services necessary for operations. Evaluate suppliers, negotiate contracts, and establish favorable terms and conditions. Ensure timely delivery of materials while adhering to budgetary constraints.  Inventory Planning & Supplier Coordination: Develop and implement inventory planning strategies to optimize stock levels. Coordinate with suppliers to maintain accurate forecasts and ensure timely replenishment.  Inventory Management: Oversee the storage, distribution, and movement of inventory within the organization. Implement inventory control measures to minimize excess or obsolete stock.  Reconciliation: Reconcile inventory records with physical stock counts to identify discrepancies. Maintain accurate records of inventory transactions and adjustments.  Maintaining Order Status: Monitor the status of purchase orders and track delivery schedules. Communicate order status updates to relevant stakeholders.  Expediting Shipment: Expedite the shipment of critical materials or products as needed. Coordinate with logistics providers to ensure timely and cost-effective transportation. Track shipments and resolve any issues related to delays or damages.  Vendor Relations: Cultivate strong relationships with suppliers and vendors. Communicate effectively with suppliers to address concerns, negotiate terms, and resolve disputes. Collaborate with vendors to improve efficiency, quality, and cost-effectiveness in the supply chain. You are someone with:  1-3 years of experience in supply chain management, procurement, or logistics.  Proficiency in MS Excel Shopify, Shiprocket, and other relevant software applications.  Good communication and interpersonal abilities.  Ability to work independently and prioritize tasks in a fast-paced environment
column13: Inventory Planning, Supply Chain Management, Procurement, Logistics

column2: The Procurement Manager will support the Director of Procurement Global Markets, Technology and Idirect to maximise value from spend and drive savings while balancing other business requirements, including quality, service, risk, and security of supply across the full bandwidth of global technology products and requirements.In addition to the above this role will need to support the cultural shift within the technology space, in order to implement a fully operational strategy led procurement function.You will be working closely with customers to challenge existing delivery models and legacy contracts, ensure corporate objectives and service needs are met, whilst working to deliver our vision of being a centre of excellence in commercial procurement. The role will actively contribute towards Conde Nasts wider business vision and ambition.The TeamYou will be part of a Global Procurement community working alongside five Procurement Managers based in Europe and five based in our global markets, reporting directly to the Director of Procurement Global Markets.Work Location: Banaglore (Hybrid)Budget: OpenExperience: 5 years to 13 yearsMandate -Global Experience: Stakeholder Management, Global Procurement,... etcIT/ Technical Procurement experience is mandate.What youll do:Work closely with the Procurement Leadership Team (PLT) providing technology category insights to help design and improve procurement procedures and deliver a strategic sourcing strategyWork with key customers and stakeholders to scope, plan and deliver technology strategiesSupport and drive change management initiatives to drive strategic procurement decisionsDevelop and plan programmes and activities to support brands and support functions to become intelligent customers when engaging with suppliersCoordinate initiatives to bring together employees from different parts of the organisation to analyse and review third party spend, and identify the most appropriate and effective approachEnsure robust governance of category management at key decision making stages.Ensure the coordination of activity and knowledge sharing across the category, wider service and beyond, through regular, formal and informal communication and collaboration with the other Procurement Managers and teamsWork with the business to conduct strategic reviews of individual suppliers and categories, using high quality market and supplier intelligence to develop strategies that deliver breakthrough resultsEnsure framework and mechanisms are in place to monitor, review and validate contract and supplier performance data. Provide leadership, direction, and challenge on performance reviews, including the review of supplier KPIs.Deliver and lead knowledgeable and professional procurement support, ensuring processes are efficient and effective, adopting best practices techniques to ensure the very highest quality service that delivers true value for our customers.Undertake external research and analysis, ensuring the identification of best practice, and assessing potential synergies with other critical and strategic contracts and wider collaborative opportunities.Develop and use intelligence on the current supply base, market, and financial data Design and lead market shaping and development activities, participate in stakeholder engagement and consultation activities Plan and lead negotiations with the supplier on all major issues regarding commercial elements of the contract. Add strategic value to the contract by influencing negotiations regarding any contractual changes ensuring value for money and introducing best practice processes.Plan, prepare and ensure the timely delivery of sourcing activities, including tender process and documentation, evaluation criteria, and the contract mobilisation and contract management framework, to ensure compliance with Conde Nast processes. Who youll be:Building strong relationships with Executive/Senior Leadership and other key or senior stakeholders Strong business acumen with high-level of numerical, literacy and analytical skillsExperience of managing procurement exercises in a large, complex and matrixed organisation Excellent knowledge and experience of global contract and commercial negotiations and the rationale underpinning it A relevant professional qualification such as MCIPS or international equivalentDegree or equivalent level of international qualification Skilled in identifying procurement strategies and tendering processes for operational and tactical contracts Proven experience of effective written and verbal communication at the highest levels, including public speaking and preparation of complex written reportsSkilled negotiator with the ability to identify and negotiate terms and conditions, contractor performance milestones, and method to monitor and report performance.Strong problem solving and analytical skillsStrong customer focus and actively listens to customers to ensure excellent services are providedAble to challenge and interpret complex management and financial data and use this to make decisions that deliver the best possible commercial solution.Passion for delivering quality, measurable services with a proven ability to set and deliver realistic, co-ordinated objectives in accordance with agreed prioritiesProfessionally represents the department, directorate, and Conde Nast in liaison with other service areas and through working with a variety of external organisationsAble to take a flexible and proactive approach to problem-solving, developing alternative approaches to resolving issues and mitigating risks.Contacts Details:Navjot Singh8660831655navjot_singh@condenast.com

column2: Perform day-to-day responsibilities of the SCRM program, including, but not limited to intake and handling of requests for new third parties, gathering documentation associated with due diligence and onboarding tasks, and maintaining the SCRM database.   Monitor third parties for changes in their risk profile, including mergers and acquisitions, regulatory changes, and other external factors.   Perform risk assessment on new and existing third parties.   Maintain the SCRM database to ensure contact information, products, and services are accurately documented.   Assist in generating standardized reports to inform business owners and management on third-party risk and performance.   Encourage and enable effective risk management change.   Provide support and expertise to business owners on third-party relationship management.   Conduct ongoing management of escalations and incidents related to due diligence and monitoring of the third parties.   Facilitate or assist in the remediation of any third-party-related findings or issues.   Contribute to the improvement of the Supply Chain Risk Management Program.   Communicate with third-party vendors to address identified risks and ensure compliance with contractual obligations and regulatory requirements.   Stay abreast of industry trends and best practices related to Supply Chain Risk Management.   Assist with any special projects.          Other Duties        Additional duties as directed by management        Job Qualifications      Bachelor s degree in Information Security, Business Administration, or a related field.   Minimum of 2 years of experience in third-party risk      Other Knowledge, Skills, Abilities, or Certifications:       Strong analytical skills, with the ability to evaluate complex data and identify potential risks and vulnerabilities.   Excellent communication skills, with the ability to effectively communicate complex information to various stakeholders.   Knowledge of regulatory requirements related to third-party risk management, such as GDPR, HIPAA, or PCI-DSS.   Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite and experience working with risk management software.   Strong organizational and time management skills.   Attention to detail, ability to prioritize work, and maintain multiple projects simultaneously.   Ability to work both independently and as part of a team to deliver quality work in a timely fashion in a fast-paced environment.

column2: Production Management:     Develop and implement production plans and strategies to meet production targets   and customer requirements.    Optimize the allocation of resources, including machines, manpower, and materials,   to ensure efficient production processes.    Monitor production schedules and ensure timely completion of orders while   maintaining quality standards.    Collaborate with the engineering team to optimize machining programs and improve   production efficiency.    Implement lean manufacturing principles to minimize waste and improve overall   productivity.     Quality Control and Assurance:     Establish and maintain quality control procedures to ensure that products meet or   exceed customer specifications.    Implement and oversee quality inspection processes to ensure adherence to quality   standards.    Conduct regular audits to identify areas for improvement and implement corrective   actions.    Work closely with the quality control team to develop and maintain quality   documentation and records.    Drive continuous improvement initiatives to enhance product quality and reduce   defects.     Supply Chain and Vendor Management:     Collaborate with vendors to improve quality, reduce lead times, and optimize costs.    Coordinate with the procurement team to ensure timely and cost-effective   procurement of materials and supplies.    Manage inventory levels to minimize stock outs and excess inventory.     Equipment Maintenance and Optimization:     Coordinate with the maintenance team to schedule and prioritize equipment repairs   and maintenance activities.    Identify opportunities for equipment upgrades and optimization to improve   productivity and efficiency.    Stay updated with the latest advancements in CNC technology and recommend   investments in new equipment as needed.     Team Management and Development:     Provide leadership and guidance to the production team, including machine operators,   programmers, and technicians.    Set performance objectives and provide regular feedback to team members to enhance   their skills and performance.    Foster a culture of teamwork, collaboration, and continuous learning within the   production department.    Conduct training sessions and workshops to develop the technical skills of the team.    Ensure a safe working environment and compliance with safety regulations.     Customer Interaction and Relationship Management:     Serve as a primary point of contact for customers, addressing inquiries, resolving   issues, and ensuring customer satisfaction.    Collaborate with the sales team to understand customer requirements and provide   technical expertise and support.    Manage customer orders and communicate production status, delivery timelines, and   any potential delays.    Conduct regular customer reviews to assess performance and identify opportunities   for improvement.    Proactively seek feedback from customers to enhance service quality and build long-   term relationships.     Reporting:     Generate regular reports on production metrics, including output, efficiency, quality,   and other key performance indicators (KPIs).    Analyse data and trends to identify areas for improvement and develop action plans   accordingly.    Prepare and present reports to senior management, highlighting operational   performance, challenges, and proposed solutions.     Team Leadership:     Provide strong leadership and guidance to the production team, fostering a positive   and collaborative work environment.    Set clear expectations, objectives, and performance targets for team members and   provide regular feedback on their performance.    Delegate tasks effectively, considering individual strengths and development   opportunities.    Foster a culture of continuous learning, professional growth, and accountability within   the team.     Leadership:     Develop and implement the overall strategic direction for the CNC machine shop in   alignment with the organization s goals and objectives.    Drive a culture of operational excellence, continuous improvement, and innovation   throughout the organization.    Stay updated with industry trends, new technologies, and best practices to enhance   operational efficiency and competitiveness.    Lead by example, demonstrating integrity, professionalism, and a strong work ethic.    Collaborate with other departments and senior management to ensure cross-functional   alignment and effective communication.     Qualification and Skills:     Bachelor s degree in engineering or a related field (preferred) or equivalent work   experience.    Proven experience in operations management within a CNC machine shop or similar   manufacturing environment.    In-depth knowledge of CNC machining processes, programming, and tooling.    Strong understanding of quality control and assurance principles and techniques.    Excellent problem-solving skills and ability to analyze data and make data-driven   decisions.    Demonstrated leadership abilities and experience in managing and motivating a team.    Exceptional organizational and time management skills, with the ability to handle   multiple priorities and meet deadlines.    Effective communication and interpersonal skills to interact with team members, vendors, and customers

column2: We are seeking a highly motivated and detail-oriented individual to join our finance team as an Accountant - CA Inter    As An employee of an Oswaal Books, the successful candidate will play a crucial role in maintaining accurate financial records, ensuring compliance with regulations, and supporting various financial activities    This position offers a dynamic work environment with opportunities for professional growth         Key Responsibilities:         1. Financial Reporting:     Prepare and analyze financial statements in compliance with accounting principles and standards.    Generate monthly, quarterly, and annual financial reports for management review.    Assist in the preparation of budgets, forecasts, and variance analysis.     2. General Accounting:     Perform day-to-day accounting activities, including journal entries, account reconciliations, and accruals.    Maintain accurate and up-to-date records of financial transactions.    Ensure compliance with internal accounting policies and procedures.     3. Tax Compliance:     Assist in the preparation and filing of various tax returns, including income tax and GST.    Stay informed about changes in tax regulations and ensure timely compliance.     4. Audit Support:     Coordinate with external auditors during the annual audit process.    Prepare audit schedules and respond to auditor inquiries in a timely manner.     5. Process Improvement:     Identify and implement process improvements to enhance efficiency and accuracy in financial reporting.    Participate in system enhancements and upgrades related to the accounting function.     6. Financial Analysis:     Conduct financial analysis to support decision-making processes.    Provide insights and recommendations based on financial data.        Qualifications:         1. Education:     Chartered Accountant (CA) Inter qualification is mandatory.     2. Experience:     Minimum of [X years] of relevant experience in accounting and finance.     3. Technical Skills:     Proficient in using accounting software (e.g., SAP, QuickBooks, etc.).    Advanced knowledge of MS Excel and other MS Office applications.     4. Communication Skills:     Strong verbal and written communication skills.    Ability to effectively communicate complex financial information to non-finance stakeholders.     5. Analytical Skills:     Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.    Attention to detail and accuracy in work.     6. Adaptability:     Ability to adapt to changes in priorities and work in a dynamic environment.

column2: Job Title: Key Account Manager (PSU/Govt) Location: Delhi & MumbaiAbout Qodenext:At Qodenext, we specialize in providing comprehensive traceability solutions, offering a range of services from technical consulting to implementation and support. Leveraging cutting-edge technologies such as Barcode, RFID, Vision, Cognitive Computing, IoT, Predictive Analysis, and emerging innovations, we empower our clients to seamlessly integrate their supply chains, ensuring end-to-end visibility and connectivity. We are currently seeking an experienced and dynamic Key Account Manager with a focus on Business Development and Sales within the PSU and Government sectors.Job Responsibilities:As the Key Account Manager for PSU and Government sectors, you will be responsible for:- Building and bringing projects to the tender stage, including specifying the tender requirements.- Participating in the project tender process and ensuring compliance with relevant regulations.- Establishing and maintaining excellent relationships with potential and existing customers to strengthen loyalty and market penetration.- Demonstrating a proven track record of selling ICT solutions and System Integration (SI) projects to various government agencies and PSUs.- Managing customer expectations at various levels and ensuring customer satisfaction.- Cultivating relationships with consulting companies and System Integrators (SI).- Gaining a deep understanding of customer requirements and market trends.- Building an ecosystem of OEMs and vendors for SI projects.Additional Requirements:- Self-starter with the ability to thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic, and multicultural environment, possessing a "CAN do" attitude.- Excellent organizational, planning, and project management skills, with experience in documentation.- Proficiency in written and spoken English is essential.- Experience working in a matrix organization structure.- 12-15 years of sales experience in PSU/Government sectors.- BE/MBA qualification.Reporting to: Senior Vice President HTA & PSUCTC: 15 - 20 lakhs per annumIf you have the required experience and skills and are ready to take on this exciting challenge, please submit your updated CV to hrd@qodenext.com

column2: Physical Inspection     Physically inspect and measure parts to determine conformance with customer requirements     Remote inspection    Review part photographs, inspection reports, and other documentation uploaded by Fictiv s manufacturing partners to our proprietary software platform, Workbench      Part release    Release all conforming parts by completing transactions in Fictiv s ERP system, ensuring parts ship on time with zero escaping defects     Part rejection   Provide clear and timely information to manufacturing partners about the reason(s) for rejection. Reviewing resubmitted parts and re-validating     Nonconformance reporting   Entering nonconformance information into Fictiv s proprietary Workbench system, so that improvement actions will be driven through our corrective action reporting process. Escalating to supplier quality engineers as necessary.     Documentation   Maintain inspection information in Fictiv s systems so that traceability exists to satisfy the requirements of our customers and our quality management system     Supporting Fictiv s industry-leading on-time, in-full (OTIF) performance    You will play a critical part in maintaining Fictiv s performance by ensuring parts are released on time and making sure that no escaping defects reach the customer. There are no partial credits - we have to do both!     Continual improvement    Collaborate with colleagues in China, India and the US to improve business processes and our proprietary software to increase efficiency and effectivity   Other tasks assigned by the Senior Supplier Quality Engineer     Desired Background Traits     BE- Mechanical with minimum of 3 years manufacturing quality control experience including the use of a broad range of manual measurement tools   Experienced with 3D printed, CNC machined, injection molded, and sheet metal fabricated parts, including finishes   Good visual acuity (will be required to pass regular eye examinations)   Good English reading and writing skills, cross-culture communication skills   Passionate about continuously improving and learning
column13: Surgical, Manufacturing process, Sheet metal, Manufacturing quality, Machine learning, Mechanical, Hardware, Manager Quality Control, Supplier quality, Logistics

column1: Junior Accountant cum Admin Manager For Congo Kinshasa - Immediate
column2: MAXIMUM AGE OF APPLICANT SHOULD NOT EXCEED 35 YEARS. Junior Accountant cum Admin Manager For Congo Kinshasa - Immediate Start!We are an offset printing company based in DR Congo, Africa - We are looking for a young mature, responsible, motivated, enthusiastic, honest, energetic accountant. Chartered accounting knowledge is highly preferred.Your responsibility will be to work alongside the General Manager and assist in the administration side of things. You must have good computer knowledge, in particular excel, work, internet and email.Please read all conditions below before applying for the job.We are looking for an active young individual who is willing to move to DR Congo in Africa for a minimum 2 year contract, but with a long term view. You must be very proactive, enthusiastic, motivated, willing to learn, take initiative and will be willing to move up the ladder in the company.This position is for an Immediate start. You will be required to have a minimum of 5 years experience as an accountant. Congo is a french speaking country, hence english language knowledge is a must, both written and spoken. Roles and Responsibilities1. Managing the daily accounting and admin operations of the company such as petty cash management, negotiating with supplier, employees, customers etc.2. Looking after importation of goods. 3. Managing Staff, Government Problems, Purchasing department, Housekeeping and General Maintenance.4. Dealing with local staff, and local accountant.5. Tally and accounting knowledge is a must. 6. Business acumen is required. 7. Prepare Cash book, Budgets, Profit and loss, balance sheet statements, cash flow statements8. Dealing with government personnel. 9. Knowledge of Tally software and accounting in a must.10. Collections of debts from customers. 11. Monitoring vehicle movements and scrutinizing expenses.12. Organising deliveries of finished goods.13. Conducting monthly physical stock take.Desired Candidate Profile1. Languages: (English a must)2. Work Experience: Atleast 5 years as an accountant in reputed industry, preferably manufacturing. 3. Educational Qualifications: Graduate/Post Grad, accounting knowledge is a must. Chartered accounting knowledge is highly regarded.4. It would be preferable if the candidate has exposure outside india.Salary & Accomodation1. Salary: Open for discussion, depends on experience $1000 - $1200US.2. Send you resume to recruitment@instaprint.org with the subject line Accountant - Kinshasa3. Accommodation and other benefits. Candidate: 1.You must be between 22 and 35 years of age 2. You must be a non drinker or light drinker. 3. You must not have any health issues and must be active and physically fit.4. You are willing to take up a new challenge in life to progress and be promoted in the company.5. You will be responsible for assisting the GM in getting the work done. You will be required to multi task and manage a team under you, so we require someone who is a responsible mature person with leadership qualities and has good negotiating skills with customers.6. We expect that you have experience in all of the above prior to coming to Congo.7. Salary range is USD 1000 - 1200 depending on experience. If your expectation is above this, then do not apply for this job.8. An online test will be required to be passed by all applicants before proceeding to the interview stage.We require a deposit of 50,000 rupees from you on acceptance of our offer. This deposit will be refunded to you within 7 days of arriving to congo. The reason for this deposit is so that we know you are serious and you will not change your mind after we begin applying for your visa and purchase your air ticket. Normally it will cost us 100,000 rupees for your visa and airticket.PLEASE ONLY APPLY IF YOU MEET ALL CRITERIA ABOVE. IF YOU DO NOT MEET ALL CRITERIA ABOVE, PLEASE DO NOT APPLY.

column2: We are looking for an iOS developer responsible for the development and maintenance of applications aimed at a range of iOS devices including mobile phones and tablet computers. Your primary focus will be development of iOS applications and their integration with back-end services. You will be working alongside other engineers and developers working on different layers of the infrastructure. Therefore, a commitment to collaborative problem solving, sophisticated design, and the creation of quality products is essential.    Responsibilities     Design and build applications for the iOS platform    Ensure the performance, quality, and responsiveness of applications    Collaborate with a team to define, design, and ship new features    Identify and correct bottlenecks and fix bugs    Help maintain code quality, organization, and automatization     Skills     Proficient with Objective-C or Swift   {{depending on project requirements}}   , and Cocoa Touch    Experience with iOS frameworks such as Core Data, Core Animation, etc.    Experience with offline storage, threading, and performance tuning    Familiarity with RESTful APIs to connect iOS applications to back-end services    Knowledge of other web technologies and UIUX standards    Understanding of Apple s design principles and interface guidelines    Knowledge of low-level C-based libraries is preferred    Experience with performance and memory tuning with tools   {{such as Instruments and Shark, depending on project needs}}     Familiarity with cloud message APIs and push notifications    Knack for benchmarking and optimization    Proficient understanding of code versioning tools   {{such as Git, Mercurial or SVN}}
column13: Performance tuning, Backend, GIT, PDF, Pharma, Mobile phones, Healthcare, Animation, IOS, Software services

column2: *Job Summary:**The senior accountant is responsible for managing and overseeing the financial activities of the organization, ensuring accuracy, compliance, and efficiency in financial operations. They play a key role in financial reporting, analysis, budgeting, and forecasting, providing valuable insights to support decision-making processes. The senior accountant may also supervise junior accounting staff and collaborate with other departments to achieve organizational goals.*Key Responsibilities:**1. **Financial Reporting:** Prepare and analyze financial statements, including balance sheets, income statements, and cash flow statements, ensuring accuracy and compliance with regulatory requirements.2. **Budgeting and Forecasting:** Assist in the development of annual budgets and long-term financial forecasts, providing insights and recommendations to support strategic planning.3. **Financial Analysis:** Conduct thorough financial analysis to identify trends, variances, and areas for improvement, and communicate findings to management.4. **General Ledger Maintenance:** Maintain the general ledger and oversee month-end and year-end closing processes, ensuring all transactions are properly recorded and reconciled.5. **Tax Compliance:** Prepare and file tax returns, ensuring compliance with local, state, and federal tax regulations, and assist with tax planning strategies.6. **Internal Controls:** Establish and maintain internal control procedures to safeguard company assets and ensure the integrity of financial data.7. **Audit Support:** Coordinate with external auditors during annual audits, providing necessary documentation and support to ensure a smooth audit process.8. **Supervision and Training:** Supervise and mentor junior accounting staff, providing guidance and training as needed to support their professional development.9. **Ad Hoc Projects:** Participate in special projects and initiatives as assigned by management, contributing financial expertise and insights to achieve organizational objectives.
column13: Accounting, Tally Software, Accounts Handling, Tally ERP, Accounting Software, Book Keeping
